intro: Isolobus cunninghamii, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces showy blue to purple flowers that bloom in late summer to early autumn. Its leaves are alternate, lance-shaped, and covered in fine hairs, giving them a silvery appearance. Isolobus cunninghamii is often found in open woodlands and along streamlines, thriving in well-drained soils.
